Vigil claims ignorance of any plot, but the existence of the missing will (which Asogi called his only weapon) implies there was a plot he might have been involved in or at least aware of. 

Another angle: Testimony 3 by Caidin mentions not knowing about negotiations between Asogi and the Prosecutor's Office. However, Evidence 19's description says the will was a "trump card," suggesting it was part of some negotiation or plan. If the will existed and was meant as a weapon, then there was indeed a plot, contradicting Vigil's claim of knowing nothing about it.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 19 (The Asogi Papers) and Testimony 2 (Vigil's denial of knowing any plot). The evidence shows there was a significant document (implying a plot), while Vigil claims he knew nothing about such a plot.
